```{r import and format data}
# for figures
island_side_colours <- c("north" = "darkblue",
                         "east" = "mediumorchid",
                         "west" = "orange")
habitat_colours <- c("fringing" = "#D81B60",
                     "backreef" = "#FFC107",
                     "outer_10" = "#1E88E5",
                     "outer_17" = "#004D40")

# some quadrats have dissimilarity = 0 or 1
# Smithson verkuilen transformation for beta-regression
sv_trans <- function(prop, N, s = 0.000005){
  (prop*(nrow(N) - 1) + s)/nrow(N)
  # where prop is the proportional value you're transforming, 
  # N is the sample size, which is specified by taking the number of rows/observations from a given dataframe,
  # and s is a small offset 
}

inv_logit <- function(x) {
  exp(x)/(1+exp(x))
}


# starting with all data now because of 0 algae transects/quadrats
data <- read.csv(here::here("data", "allbenthicdata_cleaned_colnames.csv"), stringsAsFactors = F) 

not_algae <- c("ascidian", "bare_space", "coral", "coral_rubble", "corallimorpharia", "heteractis_sp", "millepora_platyphylla", "no_data", "sand", "sarcophyton_sp", "shell_debris", "soft_coral", "sponge", "tridacna_sp", "zooxanthellae", "row_sums")


data <- data[ , -which(names(data) %in% not_algae)]

# adding island side - adapted from Julianna's code
data <- data %>% mutate(island_side = case_when(site == "lter_1" ~ "north",
                                 site == "lter_2" ~ "north",
                                 site == "lter_3" ~ "east",
                                 site == "lter_4" ~ "east",
                                 site == "lter_5" ~ "west",
                                 site == "lter_6" ~ "west"))
data$island_side_habitat <- paste(data$island_side, data$habitat)

macroalgae <- data %>% 
  select(-algal_turf, -crustose_corallines, -cyanophyta, -damselfish_turf, -lithophyllum_kotschyanum,
         -neogoniolithon_brassica_florida, -sporolithon_sp)

sand_coral <- read_csv(here("data", "allbenthicdata_cleaned_colnames.csv")) %>% 
  select(year, location, site, habitat, site_habitat, transect, quadrat, sand, coral)


# get ranges to calculate over (this is just for indexing purposes in the next bit of code)
startAlg <- grep("acanthophora_spicifera", colnames(macroalgae))
endAlg <- grep("valonia_ventricosa", colnames(macroalgae))


macroalgae %>% 
  # bring in sand data
  full_join(sand_coral) %>% 
  rename(coral_cover = coral,
         sand_cover = sand) %>% 
  mutate(hard_cover = 100-sand_cover) %>% 
  mutate(macroalgae_cover = rowSums(macroalgae[startAlg:endAlg]), # percent cover of macroalgae
         
         macroalgae_cover_hard = case_when(
           sand_cover == 100 ~ NA, # since we can't divide by a zero
           TRUE ~ (macroalgae_cover/hard_cover)*100 
           ),
         # also for corals
         coral_cover_hard = case_when(
           sand_cover == 100 ~ NA, # since we can't divide by a zero
           TRUE ~ (coral_cover/hard_cover)*100 
           )
         ) %>% # percent cover of hard substrate
   # make a year-habitat column for betadisper
  mutate(hab_year = paste0(habitat, "_", year),
         site_hab_year = paste0(site, "_", hab_year)) %>% 
  select(year, location, site, habitat, island_side, site_habitat, island_side_habitat,
         hab_year, site_hab_year, transect, quadrat, macroalgae_cover, 
         macroalgae_cover_hard, sand_cover, hard_cover, coral_cover, coral_cover_hard)  -> meta_df

meta_df$all_algae_cover <- rowSums(data[startAlg:endAlg]) # percent cover of all algae
meta_df$all_algae_cover_hard <- case_when(
           meta_df$sand_cover == 100 ~ NA, # since we can't divide by a zero
           TRUE ~ (meta_df$all_algae_cover/meta_df$hard_cover)*100   
         )

data <- merge(meta_df, data )
macroalgae <- merge(meta_df, macroalgae)


meta_cols <- colnames(meta_df)

full_species_cols <- colnames(data)[!colnames(data) %in% meta_cols]
macro_species_cols <- colnames(macroalgae)[!colnames(macroalgae) %in% meta_cols]


# summarize at site level
site_full <- data %>%
  dplyr::group_by(year, island_side, site, habitat, site_habitat, hab_year, site_hab_year) %>%
  dplyr::summarize(across(all_of(
    c("macroalgae_cover", "macroalgae_cover_hard", "sand_cover", "hard_cover", "coral_cover",
      "coral_cover_hard","all_algae_cover", "all_algae_cover_hard", full_species_cols)), mean, na.rm = TRUE))


# summarize at species level
site_macro <- macroalgae %>%
  dplyr::group_by(year, island_side, site, habitat, site_habitat, hab_year, site_hab_year) %>%
  dplyr::summarize(across(all_of(
    c("macroalgae_cover", "macroalgae_cover_hard", "sand_cover", "hard_cover", "coral_cover",
      "coral_cover_hard","all_algae_cover", "all_algae_cover_hard", macro_species_cols)), mean, na.rm = TRUE))


# extract site level meta_df for future merges
site_meta_df <- site_full[,which(names(site_full) %in% meta_cols)]

fringing <- subset(data, habitat == "fringing")
backreef <- subset(data, habitat == "backreef")
outer10 <- subset(data, habitat == "outer_10")
outer17 <- subset(data, habitat == "outer_17")

fringing_macro <- subset(macroalgae, habitat == "fringing")
backreef_macro <- subset(macroalgae, habitat == "backreef")
outer10_macro <- subset(macroalgae, habitat == "outer_10")
outer17_macro <- subset(macroalgae, habitat == "outer_17")


fringing_site <- subset(site_full, habitat == "fringing")
backreef_site <- subset(site_full, habitat == "backreef")
outer10_site <- subset(site_full, habitat == "outer_10")
outer17_site <- subset(site_full, habitat == "outer_17")

fringing_site_macro <- subset(site_macro, habitat == "fringing")
backreef_site_macro <- subset(site_macro, habitat == "backreef")
outer10_site_macro <- subset(site_macro, habitat == "outer_10")
outer17_site_macro <- subset(site_macro, habitat == "outer_17")
```

Moving all site level analyses to before quadrat for beta diversity


```{r site level bray curtis setup}
fringing_site_species_matrix <- as.matrix(fringing_site[ , -which(names(fringing_site) %in% meta_cols)])
fringing_site_species_matrix <- fringing_site_species_matrix/fringing_site$hard_cover # convert from percent to proportion of hard cover
rownames(fringing_site_species_matrix) <- paste(fringing_site$year,"-", fringing_site$site_habitat, sep = "")


# filter rare species
# fringing_site_species_presence <- colSums(fringing_site_species_matrix > 0) # Presence absence matrix
# fringing_site_species_percentage <- (fringing_site_species_presence/nrow(fringing_site_species_matrix)) # proportion of rows where a species is present
# fringing_site_common_species <- names(fringing_site_species_percentage[fringing_site_species_percentage > 0.05]) # filter for presence in more than 5% of quads - only 9 species...
# fringing_site_species_matrix <- fringing_site_species_matrix[,colnames(fringing_site_species_matrix) %in% fringing_site_common_species] # filter original species matrix

fringing_site_rows_to_remove <- rowSums(fringing_site_species_matrix) == 0 # remove rows with no algal species observed - thought this was done already
fringing_site_species_matrix <- fringing_site_species_matrix[!fringing_site_rows_to_remove,] 

fringing_site_species_matrix_untransformed <- fringing_site_species_matrix
fringing_site_species_matrix_transformed <- asin(sqrt(fringing_site_species_matrix)) # arcsin squareroot transform
fringing_site_subset <- fringing_site[!fringing_site_rows_to_remove,] # make sure rows are also removed from dataframe
fringing_site_subset$stratum <- paste(fringing_site_subset$year,"-", fringing_site_subset$site_habitat, sep = "") # for merging with bray matrix later



brayfringing_site <- vegdist(fringing_site_species_matrix_transformed, "bray") # create bray dissimilarity matrix
# View(brayfringing_site)
brayfringing_site_untransformed <- vegdist(fringing_site_species_matrix_untransformed, "bray")
fringing_site_braymat <- as.matrix(brayfringing_site) # conver to matrix object
# convert to pairwise comparison
fringing_site_comp <- fringing_site_braymat[lower.tri(fringing_site_braymat)] # extract lower triangle
fringing_site_row_indices <- row(fringing_site_braymat)[lower.tri(fringing_site_braymat)] # extract row indices for first quad in comparison
fringing_site_col_indices <- col(fringing_site_braymat)[lower.tri(fringing_site_braymat)] # extract col indices = second quad in comp
fringing_site_loc1 <- rownames(fringing_site_braymat)[fringing_site_row_indices] # populate appropriate vector
fringing_site_loc2 <- colnames(fringing_site_braymat)[fringing_site_col_indices] # populate appropriate vector
fringing_site_pairwise_df <- data.frame(loc1 = fringing_site_loc1, loc2 = fringing_site_loc2, dissimilarity = fringing_site_comp)
fringing_site_pairwise_df$year1 <- as.numeric(sub("(.*)-.*", "\\1", fringing_site_pairwise_df$loc1)) # extract timepoint from first quad in comp
fringing_site_pairwise_df$year2 <- as.numeric(sub("(.*)-.*", "\\1", fringing_site_pairwise_df$loc2)) # repeat for second quad
fringing_site_pairwise_df$time <- abs(fringing_site_pairwise_df$year2 - fringing_site_pairwise_df$year1) # extract length of differences
fringing_site_pairwise_df$site_1 <- sub(".*-(.*)", "\\1", fringing_site_pairwise_df$loc1) # extract quadrat id from first quad in comp
fringing_site_pairwise_df$site_2 <- sub(".*-(.*)", "\\1", fringing_site_pairwise_df$loc2) # repeat for second quad
```

```{r site bray dissimilarity over time, fig.height=15, fig.width=15}
outer17_site_pairwise_subset <- outer17_site_pairwise_df[outer17_site_pairwise_df$site_1 == outer17_site_pairwise_df$site_2,]

                     backreef_site_pairwise_subset,
                     outer10_site_pairwise_subset,
                     outer17_site_pairwise_subset)
# site_1 and site_2 columns are all the same now
# create new col just called for merge with other metadata

bray_time_series_site <- left_join(unique(site_meta_df[ , c("site", "site_habitat", "habitat", "island_side")]), comb_site_subset, by = "site_habitat")


# model



# transformed dissimilarities
bray_time_series_site$dissimilarity_trans <- sv_trans(bray_time_series_site$dissimilarity, bray_time_series_site)

bray_mod_site <- glmmTMB(dissimilarity_trans ~ time*habitat + (1 | site),
                              na.action = na.pass, family = beta_family(link = "logit"), data = bray_time_series_site) #
summary(bray_mod_site) 
hist(residuals(bray_mod_site)) # slight skew but not awful
plot(residuals(bray_mod_site) ~ fitted(bray_mod_site)) # some heteroskedasticity but not bad
Anova(bray_mod_site)
emtrends(bray_mod_site, pairwise ~ habitat , "time") # no sig differences
bray_trends_emm_site <- emmip(bray_mod_site, habitat ~ time , at = list(time = seq(1,16,1)), plotit = F, CIs = T)


ggplot()+
   geom_point(data = bray_time_series_site, aes(x = time, y = dissimilarity, colour = habitat), alpha = 0.1 ) +
   geom_line(data = bray_trends_emm_site, aes(x = time, y = inv_logit(yvar), colour = habitat), linewidth = 2) +
   geom_ribbon(data = bray_trends_emm_site, aes(x = time, ymin = inv_logit(LCL), ymax = inv_logit(UCL), fill = habitat), alpha = 0.3) +
   scale_colour_manual(values = habitat_colours) +
   scale_fill_manual(values = habitat_colours) +

   labs(y = "Dissimilarity\n") +
   theme_bw() + 
   theme(panel.grid.major = element_blank(), 
         panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
         panel.background = element_blank(),
         plot.title = element_text(color = "grey20", size = 32, vjust = 0, face = "plain"),
         axis.line.y = element_line(colour = "black"),
         axis.text.y = element_text(color = "grey20", size = 28, hjust = .5, vjust = .5, face = "plain"),
         axis.title.y = element_text(color = "grey20", size = 32, hjust = .5, vjust = 0, face = "plain"),
         axis.line.x = element_line(colour = "black"),
         axis.text.x = element_text(color = "grey20", size = 28, angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1, face = "plain"),
         axis.title.x = element_text(color = "grey20", size = 32, hjust = .5, vjust = 0, face = "plain"),
```

```{r site macroalgae bray dissimilarity over time, fig.height=15, fig.width=15}
comb_site_macro_subset <- rbind(fringing_site_macro_pairwise_subset,
                     backreef_site_macro_pairwise_subset,
                     outer10_site_macro_pairwise_subset,
                     outer17_site_macro_pairwise_subset)
# site_1 and site_2 columns are all the same now
# create new col just called for merge with other metadata
comb_site_macro_subset$site_habitat <- comb_site_macro_subset$site_1

# model
# transformed dissimilarities
bray_time_series_site_macro$dissimilarity_trans <- sv_trans(bray_time_series_site_macro$dissimilarity, bray_time_series_site_macro)

bray_mod_site_macro <- glmmTMB(dissimilarity_trans ~ time*habitat + (1 | site),
                              na.action = na.pass, family = beta_family(link = "logit"), data = bray_time_series_site_macro) #
summary(bray_mod_site_macro) 
hist(residuals(bray_mod_site_macro)) # slight skew but not awful
plot(residuals(bray_mod_site_macro) ~ fitted(bray_mod_site_macro)) # stronger patterning here - negative slope

emtrends(bray_mod_site_macro, pairwise ~ habitat , "time") # fringing slope significantly different from all others
bray_trends_emm_site_macro <- emmip(bray_mod_site_macro, habitat ~ time , at = list(time = seq(1,16,1)), plotit = F, CIs = T)


ggplot()+
   geom_point(data = bray_time_series_site_macro, aes(x = time, y = dissimilarity, colour = habitat), alpha = 0.1 ) +
   geom_line(data = bray_trends_emm_site_macro, aes(x = time, y = inv_logit(yvar), colour = habitat), linewidth = 2) +
   geom_ribbon(data = bray_trends_emm_site_macro, aes(x = time, ymin = inv_logit(LCL), ymax = inv_logit(UCL), fill = habitat), alpha = 0.3) +

   theme_bw() +
```

```{r beta dispersion all algae, fig.height=15, fig.width=15}
full_site_betadisper <- vegan::betadisper(full_site_bray, full.site.scores_site$hab_year)
site_full$betadispersion <- full_site_betadisper$distances[match(site_full$stratum, names(full_site_betadisper$distances))]
site_full$betadispersion_trans <- sv_trans(site_full$betadispersion, site_full)

betadisper_site_mod <- glmmTMB(betadispersion_trans ~ year*habitat + (1|site), family = beta_family(link = "logit"), data = site_full)
summary(betadisper_site_mod) # fair bit of within site variance - inv_logit(0.04) = 0.5
hist(residuals(betadisper_site_mod)) # pretty good
plot(residuals(betadisper_site_mod) ~ fitted(betadisper_site_mod)) # slight heteroskedasticity
Anova(betadisper_site_mod)
#                Chisq Df Pr(>Chisq)    
# year         12.9561  1  0.0003189 ***
# habitat      27.2191  3  5.296e-06 ***
# year:habitat  6.8472  3  0.0769311 .  

emtrends(betadisper_site_mod, pairwise ~ habitat , "year") # fringing slope significantly different from outer17
```

```{r quad bray curtis setup}
rownames(fringing_species_matrix) <- paste(fringing$year,"-", fringing$location, sep = "")


# filter rare species
fringing_species_presence <- colSums(fringing_species_matrix > 0) # Presence absence matrix
fringing_species_percentage <- (fringing_species_presence/nrow(fringing_species_matrix)) # proportion of rows where a species is present
fringing_common_species <- names(fringing_species_percentage[fringing_species_percentage > 0.05]) # filter for presence in more than 5% of quads - only 9 species...

fringing_species_matrix <- fringing_species_matrix[!fringing_rows_to_remove,] 
fringing_species_matrix <- na.omit(fringing_species_matrix)

fringing_species_matrix_untransformed <- fringing_species_matrix
fringing_species_matrix_transformed <- asin(sqrt(fringing_species_matrix)) # arcsin squareroot transform

fringing_col_indices <- col(fringing_braymat)[lower.tri(fringing_braymat)] # extract col indices = second quad in comp

fringing_loc2 <- colnames(fringing_braymat)[fringing_col_indices] # populate appropriate vector

fringing_pairwise_df$year2 <- as.numeric(sub("(.*)-.*", "\\1", fringing_pairwise_df$loc2)) # repeat for second quad
```

```{r bray dissimilarity over time, fig.height=15, fig.width=15}
# Smithson verkuilen transformation for beta-regression
sv_trans <- function(prop, N, s = 0.000005){
  (prop*(nrow(N) - 1) + s)/nrow(N)
  # where prop is the proportional value you're transforming, 
  # N is the sample size, which is specified by taking the number of rows/observations from a given dataframe,
  # and s is a small offset 
}

inv_logit <- function(x) {
  exp(x)/(1+exp(x))
}

# transformed dissimilarities
bray_time_series$dissimilarity_trans <- sv_trans(bray_time_series$dissimilarity, bray_time_series)
bray_untransformed_time_series$dissimilarity_trans <- sv_trans(bray_untransformed_time_series$dissimilarity, bray_time_series)

bray_mod_universal <- glmmTMB(dissimilarity_trans ~ time*habitat*island_side + (1 | island_side/site/transect/location),
                              na.action = na.pass, family = beta_family(link = "logit"), data = bray_time_series) #
```
